title.value: The epidemiological impact of the Canadian COVID Alert app
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper, and it indicates that the paper's main focus is on assessing the impact of the Canadian COVID Alert app on COVID-19 infections and deaths.
title.quote: The epidemiological impact of the Canadian COVID Alert app

extractions.description: This paper analyzes the effectiveness of the Canadian COVID Alert app in reducing COVID-19 infections and deaths. It uses a comparative study and modeling to estimate the impact of the app, considering data on notifications and transmission rates in Canada.

type.justification: The paper conducts a comparative study and modeling based on real-world data to assess the impact of the COVID Alert app.
type.quote: Methods Two separate but complementary approaches were taken. First, we undertook a comparative study...

name.justification: The research focuses on the impact of a public health tool, the Canadian COVID Alert app, on population health during the COVID-19 pandemic.
name.quote: The coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic represents a substantial challenge for public health, pandemic planning, and healthcare systems.

name.justification: The study involves epidemiological modeling to estimate the cases and deaths averted by the COVID Alert app.
name.quote: Our model indicates that use of the COVID Alert app averted between 6284 and 10,894 infections...

name.justification: The paper examines the impact of a digital health application, the COVID Alert app.
name.quote: The COVID Alert app was designed to offer a high degree of privacy to users...

name.justification: The paper uses an epidemiological model to estimate the number of infections and deaths averted due to the COVID Alert app.
name.quote: Our model indicates that use of the COVID Alert app averted between 6284 and 10,894 infections...

is_contributed.justification: The model itself is not a new contribution but rather an application of existing modeling techniques with slight adaptations.
is_contributed.quote: In brief, these authors used an approach that models the number of cases averted...

is_executed.justification: The paper does not indicate execution on specific computational hardware like GPU or CPU.
is_executed.quote: The process to obtain a one-time key to upload a positive COVID-19 test is different in each province and territory; thus, it is possible that some users do not ever receive a key.

is_compared.justification: The model's estimates are compared with adoption rates and other app usage statistics.
is_compared.quote: Our analyses suggest that a considerable number of cases were averted by usage of the app.

referenced_paper_title.value: The epidemiological impact of the NHS COVID-19 App
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references similar modeling work done for the NHS COVID-19 App to draw parallels and adopt methodologies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To assess the impact of COVID Alert on mitigating virus transmission, we estimated the number of COVID-19 cases averted... as proposed by Wymant et al. (2021).
